punter.translation[0].definitions[0].def: someone who buys a product or service
punter.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: You need something to pull in the punters  (=attract them).
The technical details mean nothing to the average punter.
punter.translation[0].definitions[1].def: someone who bets on the result of a horse race etc
punter.translation[0].definitions[2].def: the player who punts the ball in American football
punter.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a person who tries to make money buying and selling shares etc on a financial market
punter.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Such privatisations are aimed more at the general punter than the industrial investor.
punters on the commodities and futures markets
punter.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: We try to give the punters what they want.
For the average punter the most important thing is the price.
